urls.title: Hindustan Times
urls.description: There is a luminescence to the films of this time. You can see it with your eyes closed, hear it in the music. Some of India’s finest storytellers were in their prime. Two films were released in Mumbai, then Bombay, on Independence Day: Shehnai and Mera Geet. While the latter vanished from theatres and memory in no time, the PL Santoshi-directed Shehnai from Filmistan Studio became a huge success. The story of four spirited, independent young girls, it had racy, hummable songs (we still remember Aana
